title: Clarify that the different help suggestions can not be used together

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=2527d830a9efb6bbeb947dd2a2a47c74

```rust
fn one() -> i32 {
    1
}

fn foobar() {
    one()
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0308]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0308): mismatched types
 --> src/lib.rs:6:5
  |
6 |     one()
  |     ^^^^^ expected `()`, found `i32`
  |
help: consider using a semicolon here
  |
6 |     one();
  |          +
help: try adding a return type
  |
5 | fn foobar() -> i32 {
  |             ++++++
```

Ideally the output should clarify that the different help suggestions can't be used together, rather the developer can pick one of them.

@rustbot claim
